website_summaries.verdict: The Asics NitroFuze 2 was mostly well-received by consumers who wanted to have a neutral shoe for their adventures on the road. They appreciated its lightweight design, its appealing looks, and its apparently capable components. A person didn’t have a positive experience with this product, but it’s an isolated response that’s drowned by mostly positive reviews.
pros: Several runners noted that the Asics NitroFuze 2 was aptly lightweight
Many consumers described the cushioning system as comfortable for daily use
The design was lauded for being sporty and contemporary
The available widths were accurate to the expectations of most purchasers
Some users welcomed the durable construction of the materials
Many people appreciated that it performed well on flat surfaces like the asphalt
cons: A consumer complained of some discomfort when she was wearing this shoe

customer_reviews.title: A waste of money
customer_reviews.text: At first very comfortable but 2 months in the soles are worn down and there is a hole in one of them. I only use them for work and I am at my desk most of my working day. Very poor quality and a waste of money. 30/08/18 - Decided to contact Amazon who have given me refund despite out of the returns windows
customer_reviews.author: David Harrison

customer_reviews.title: So Far S0 Good
customer_reviews.text: they turned up early and looked like they should look. i have used them - but only once so far as it has done nothing but rain since my last run and i would like to keep them a bit cleaner a little longer ! they were a bit stiff for the first half a mile or so - probably due to the newness - but once i had gone past they mile they were quit comfy.
customer_reviews.author: David Dawson

customer_reviews.title: Fit well, good for walking but terrible for running
customer_reviews.text: Fit as expected and good for walking. However, when running the right shoe presses on my toenail, so much so as it has made it all blue and bruised up. Literally unusable if you want to go for a jog wearing them. It's really weird because I have no problems with the left foot, but there is a slightly harder bump in the fabric(probably glue) right above my toenail which makes it really uncomfortable to run with those sneakers.
customer_reviews.author: Momchil

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Bought for training runs, only done a couple of sessions on a treadmill so far, fit well, comfortable and quite a bit lighter than I expected too. 9mm heel drop nice to run for me but I know that's personal preference.
customer_reviews.author: Garry

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice and comfy straight out of the box. Lots of support.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good shoes for jogging.
customer_reviews.text: Nice and comfortable. The sole could have been slightly more comfortable but overall for the price a very good product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Attractive looking and bargain price
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable and not bad looking. Excellent value for money.
customer_reviews.author: Jaws75

customer_reviews.title: Great product did a half marathon 5 days after getting ...
customer_reviews.text: Great product did a half marathon 5 days after getting them no issues (apart from my own lack of fitness)
customer_reviews.author: Mark Tinson

customer_reviews.title: Decent
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable and offers great ankle support (if you lace them tight)
customer_reviews.author: Mr R.

customer_reviews.title: The worst Asics I've ever had, by far
customer_reviews.text: I've been running for a few years and for the last 3 years I run exclusively with Asics, this model is the worst running shoes I've ever had, by far. They have too much room around the foot, also with these you feel the impact on the floor, such doesn't happen with the other Asics models I've had. Its like it doesn't even have gel. I bought these because it was on sale, now I wish I'd paid more for a proper pair of shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Vitor Fernandes

customer_reviews.title: Rubbish
customer_reviews.text: I’ve worn Asics running shoes for many years and have never been disappointed. These however are, by far, the worst trainers I’ve ever owned. Unfortunately for me I didn’t find out how poor they were until I’d walked several miles in them, so no chance of a refund. Avoid!
customer_reviews.author: Hilldee

customer_reviews.title: Great pair of shoes
customer_reviews.text: Great pair of shoes. Needed a new pair to use in the gym and for general running about to and from places. These fit the bill very nicely. Only criticism is when biking the wind blows straight through the mesh at the front so I get cold toes.
customer_reviews.author: Malkation

customer_reviews.title: Keep doing what you are doing
customer_reviews.text: So comfortable. I am a female and I love men trainers because of the width and comfort.
customer_reviews.author: Mimi

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good value leisure shoe but not really a running shoe
customer_reviews.author: R. P. Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: Been wearing them at work for a few months now. The feet are correclty supported and the plastic sole isnt soft or hard enough to tire the feet. Exactly as much needed to keep you comfortable. Will update in a few months.
customer_reviews.author: ASDIC

product_meta.title: ASICS Men's Nitrofuze 2 Running Shoes
product_meta.description: Asics Men's shoe Nitrofuze 2 perfect for running and leisure thanks to the combination of style and performance. A mesh upper that is very breathable and provides your feet with freshness and comfort. FuzeGEL midsole technology to provide rearfoot shock absorption. Patterned sturdy rubber outsole for traction and grip. Reflective material from 3M provides security and visibility for your runs in the dark. Eyelets with lace up closure for secure fit.
feature_bullets: FuzeGEL midsole - For energy return and shock absorption.
Solid rubber outsole - For reliable traction.
AHAR - Placed on high-stress areas for abrasion resistance.
